item.title: [LGEINDIA] LG Electronics India Ltd. Signs Advance Pricing Agreement with CBDT, Reducing Contingent Liabilities by INR 4,877.38 Million
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

LG Electronics India Ltd. has signed an Advance Pricing Agreement (APA) with the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) in India, effective from April 1, 2014, to March 31, 2023. The APA signing led to the reduction of contingent liabilities related to direct taxes by INR 1,724.38 Million and eliminated a contingency amount of INR 3,153.00 Million for royalty payments to LG Electronics Inc., Korea (Promoter). The company will incur a net tax expense of INR 177.12 Million (excluding applicable interest) and pay a net amount of INR 38.59 Million to LG Electronics Inc. for secondary adjustment provisions compliance with Indian transfer pricing laws.

  • LG Electronics India Ltd. signed an Advance Pricing Agreement (APA) with the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) in India
  • APA effective from April 1, 2014, to March 31, 2023
  • Contingent liabilities related to direct taxes reduced by INR 1,724.38 Million
  • Elimination of contingency amount of INR 3,153.00 Million for royalty payments to LG Electronics Inc., Korea (Promoter)
  • Net tax expense of INR 177.12 Million (excluding applicable interest) and a net amount of INR 38.59 Million to LG Electronics Inc. for secondary adjustment provisions compliance

item.title: [CRISIL] CRISIL Ltd Schedules Board Meeting to Approve Q4 and FY2025 Financial Results and Dividend Payment
item.description:
CRISIL Ltd, a company of S&P Global, has informed the BSE that its Board of Directors will meet on February 12 and 13, 2026, to consider and approve the audited consolidated and standalone financial results for the fourth quarter and year ended December 31, 2025. The Board will also consider the payment of a final dividend for the financial year ending December 31, 2025. The 'No Trading Window' for the employees of Crisil Limited and its subsidiary companies has commenced from December 16, 2025, to February 17, 2026.

  • CRISIL Ltd to consider and approve Q4 and FY2025 financial results on February 12 and 13, 2026
  • The company will also consider the payment of a final dividend for FY2025
  • The 'No Trading Window' for employees of Crisil Limited and its subsidiaries is in effect from December 16, 2025, to February 17, 2026

item.description:

item.title: [HMT] HMT Ltd Files Application to Strike Off Subsidiary HMT Watches Limited
item.description:
HMT Ltd has filed an application with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs, Government of India, to strike off the name of its wholly owned subsidiary, HMT Watches Limited, from the records of the Registrar of Companies under section 248 of the Companies Act, 2013. This move comes after the approval of the Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs in its meeting dated January 6, 2016, for the closure of three subsidiary companies of HMT Limited, namely: HMT Watches Limited, HMT Bearings Limited and HMT Chinar Watches Limited. The stock exchanges were previously informed about the status of this process at various stages.

  • HMT Ltd files application to strike off HMT Watches Limited
  • Application filed with Ministry of Corporate Affairs, Government of India
  • Move follows approval of Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs in 2016
  • Three subsidiary companies including HMT Watches Limited were approved for closure
  • Stock exchanges previously informed about the process

item.title: [ANGELONE] Ajit Sinha Joins Angel One as General Counsel
item.description:
Angel One Limited, a leading FinTech player, announces that Ajit Sinha has joined as General Counsel. With over 24 years of experience in corporate law, financial services, capital markets, and banking, Ajit will lead the legal function and provide strategic counsel to the Board and leadership team. He joins from the National Stock Exchange of India Limited (NSE), where he served as Vice President and Heading the Corporate Legal team since December 2018. Ajit's experience across exchanges, banking, and capital markets will be invaluable as Angel One scales its businesses and innovates responsibly within a strong regulatory framework.

  • Ajit Sinha joins Angel One as General Counsel
  • Over 24 years of experience in corporate law, financial services, capital markets, and banking
  • Will lead the legal function and provide strategic counsel to the Board and leadership team
  • Joins from the National Stock Exchange of India Limited (NSE)

item.title: [CDG] Jujhar Logistic & Travels Limited, a CDG Petchem Subsidiary, Reports Strong Operating & Financial Performance in 9M FY26
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Jujhar Logistic & Travels Limited, a 51% subsidiary of CDG Petchem Ltd, has announced strong operating and financial performance for the first nine months of FY26. The company, a leading automotive logistics solutions provider, achieved significant growth across key operating and financial metrics compared to FY25. Despite a challenging macro & operating environment, Jujhar Logistic & Travels Ltd reported a revenue from operations of 159.88 Cr, an EBITDA of 33.14 Cr, and a Profit After Tax of 20.39 Cr for 9M FY26.

  • Revenue from Operations for 9M FY26 is 159.88 Cr, compared to 124.87 Cr in FY25
  • EBITDA for 9M FY26 is 33.14 Cr, compared to 32.90 Cr in FY25
  • Profit After Tax for 9M FY26 is 20.39 Cr, compared to 22.64 Cr in FY25
  • Jujhar Logistic & Travels Ltd became a subsidiary of CDG Petchem Ltd on 18 November 2025
  • The company serves leading Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) including Maruti, Mahindra, Tata, Kia, Hyundai, Skoda, Toyata, and Land Rover

item.title: [GRANDFONRY] Madhu Garg Sells 70.16% Shares of Grand Foundry Ltd Through Open Offer
item.description:
According to a disclosure made under Regulation 29(2) of SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares & Takeovers) Regulations, 2011, Madhu Garg has sold 2,13,50,360 Equity Shares of Grand Foundry Limited, representing 70.16% of its paid-up equity share capital. The sale was made through a share purchase agreement in terms of an open offer. The transaction took place on 24th January 2026. After the sale, Madhu Garg does not hold any shares or voting rights in Grand Foundry Ltd.

  • Madhu Garg sells 70.16% shares of Grand Foundry Ltd
  • Sale through share purchase agreement in open offer
  • Transaction amount: 2,13,50,360 Equity Shares
  • Sale date: 24th January 2026
  • No shares or voting rights held by Madhu Garg after the sale
